job_title: Physical Plant Manager in Bloomington, IL
pros: Working w/ students and faculty at a university.
cons: No raise or cost of living raise in 10 years still making the new min. Wage at $15 doubt any new hire at this company will ever get a raise and former employee’s will be now making the same as new employee’s? No raises and no advancement. Have to work w/ temp. Employees daily and Full time employees can’t get work done because they can’t employ enough people for the work that needs to be done? Horrible moral and workplace environment. It is ran like a boot camp? No place for military styles in a public sector? Even though they want to claim they are a private business👎 Sucks!

pros: Office furnishings were very nice

review_title: Good to see if you like Teaching Math
pros:
Good to see if you like teaching math.
Can be relevant experience if you want to be a teacher or go to graduate school.
cons:
IWU isn't as selective as it used to be. Some kids will be too lazy in Calc so you'll have to fail them (please don't let them slip by).
There is always one kid who doesn't know say, FOILing or something.

Also IWU doesn't have tons of name recognition when you graduate. Which SUCKS. It makes me wonder if I should've gone to U of I.

How bad\good TAing is varys greatly on the professor you work under and what class you are teaching. An intermediately hard class is best. The HW is super hard to grade, but not everyone takes it.

review_title: Small team, terrible pay, decent benefits.
pros: Staff receive 20 vacation days a year on top of time off between Christmas and New Years. Unlimited professional development time (if your position has a budget for that). Unlimited sick time, too. It's a pretty small school, so job descriptions are all but worthless; you'll end up working on lots of different things based on your interests.
cons: The pay is absolutely terrible, and we haven't gotten a raise in something like eight years, so a lot of our best employees are bailing.

review_title: Ames Library Circulation Desk Student Assistant
job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant, Ames Library in Bloomington, IL
pros: Its a great job-mainly shelving books for a bit and siting at the desk checking out/checking in books. Friendly staff and you are even able to do homework when you're not attending to something, which happens more so than not
cons: None I can think of. Good place to work i must say. Good place to work I must say. Good place to work I must say. God place to work i must say

pros: I worked as a residential desk aide all four years I was there. Easy application process. I had really nice RCAs and RDs (supervisors) in all the halls I worked in. I was able to get to know so many people who lived in my building or, when I lived and worked in two separate halls, in other halls. Great for my resume.
cons: There were some issues when I applied my last year--email response on whether I got the job or not, and where I would be working was slower than usual. Other than that, no other cons.

review_title: Decent culture and environment, low pay as expected
pros: Work as a TA is fairly easy to do and it won't destroy your work life balance.
cons: Grading is a pain in the rear, and often times a lot of students only care about grades. Being a TA is a minimum wage job, so don't expect glamour and enough wealth to pay off your student loans, and you won't get a ton of hours either. But that's the sacrifice you make if you're also a student and have other assignments to do.

review_title: It is a great place to work.
pros:
The location is great. 
The staff is very nice. 
The benefits are great as well as the time off.
Parking and the fitness center is free for faculty and staff.
cons:
The size of the school, if you want more amenities.
The students are very needy and the culture caters to all of their wants.

review_title: A great job; good to place to learn more about repairing computers and working with a team
pros:
Get to help people
Have a great boss
Learn new skills
Work with team members and improve team skills
Hires both work study and pay roll students
cons:
Work is based on people reporting issues, so some week have a lot and some have a little
Minimum wage and work study can only work 10 hours a week

review_title: Not preparatory for future jobs, but doable as a full-time student.
pros: It's convenient to work on campus as a student. Typically there will be priorities placed on your class schedule.
cons: Many times coworkers will not respond to requests for taking shifts, and the blame falls on you. It's difficult to define ones job working for ORL.
